controller
Class JointRecorder

java.lang.Object
  controller.JointRecorder
All Implemented Interfaces:
xmlGestureParser<JointRecorder>, java.io.Serializable
public class JointRecorder
extends java.lang.Object
implements xmlGestureParser<JointRecorder>

JointRecorder records the position of joints and can be used to access the location of a joint at a specific point in time. Recording does not support multiple users, more that one user may interfere with recording.

Author:
Levi Lindsley
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

JointRecorder

public JointRecorder()
Default Constructor. joints and recorder are initialized and playBackTick is set to 0, mirror is false by default.

Method Detail

addJoint

public boolean addJoint(java.lang.Integer j)
Adds a joint if it is not already in the set. Joints may not be added if there is recorded data, thus data may be added if isEmpty() is true.

Parameters:
j - : Integer to add to joints
Returns:
True if j added successfully. False if j already existed or record data exists

addAll

public boolean addAll()
Adds all joint locations tracked by SimpleOpenNI into the recorder. This is done by calling addLeft(), addright() and addCenter(). If record exists returns False and adds no points.

Returns:
True if at least one point was added to joints. False if a current record exist or no points were added.
See Also:
addLeft(), addRight(), addCenter()

addLeft

public boolean addLeft()
Adds Left: Shoulder, elbow, hand, hip, knee, and foot (in order) to the current tracked set.

Returns:
True if at least one point was added to joints. False if a current record exist or no points were added.
See Also:
addRight()

addRight

public boolean addRight()
Adds Right: Shoulder, elbow, hand, hip, knee, and foot (in order) to the current tracked set.

Returns:
True if at least one point was added to joints. False if a current record exist or no points were added.
See Also:
addLeft()

addCenter

public boolean addCenter()
Adds Head, Neck and Torso into the tracked set

Returns:
True if at least one point was added to joints. False if a current record exist or no points were added.

mirror

private void mirror()

flipMirror

public boolean flipMirror()
Flips the mirror mode and mirrors all current focus joints. This could invalidate recordings so it may only be done without an active record if a record is active then this function will return false and mirror will NOT change.

Returns:
True if the recording is empty.

False if there is a current record

getMirror

public boolean getMirror()
Returns:
the value of mirror
See Also:
mirror, mirror()

record

public void record(SimpleOpenNI.SimpleOpenNI context,
                   int user)
Takes a snapshot of each focus joint and adds to record

Parameters:
context - : SimpleOpenNI instance to retrieve skeletal data from
user - : user id to retrieve skeleton from

getJoint

public processing.core.PVector getJoint(int tick,
                                        int joint)
Retrieves the position of a joint at a given time

Parameters:
tick - : the number of ticks from the beginning of the recording
joint - : the index of the joint to retrieve
Returns:
PVector representing joint at the given time, this is the same as calling GestureController.getRealcoordinites() at the time that the recording represents.

resetPlayBack

public void resetPlayBack()
Sets playBackTick to 0 restarting play back

playBack

public java.util.List<processing.core.PVector[]> playBack()
Calls JointRecorder#playBack(Set) with the joints that this records

Returns:
List of PVector[2] each representing the coordinates of a joint
See Also:
JointRecorder#playBack(Set)

playBack

public java.util.List<processing.core.PVector[]> playBack(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> focus)
Steps through the recording one tick per call to this function the playBackTick is auto incremented. Joint pairs are determined by generic human anatomy and joint pairs are only included in the result if both joints are available in the recording and in focus.

Parameters:
focus - : list of joints to include in return vector
Returns:
List of PVector[2] each representing the coordinates of a joint
See Also:
JointRecorder#playBack(int, Set)

playBack

public java.util.List<processing.core.PVector[]> playBack(int tick,
                                                          java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> focus)
Joint pairs are determined by generic human anatomy and joint pairs are only included in the result if both joints are available in the recording and in focus.

Parameters:
tick - : recording tick to use for return value
focus - : collection of joints
Returns:
List of PVector[2] each representing the coordinates of a joint
See Also:
JointRecorder#playBack(Set)

playBack

public java.util.List<processing.core.PVector[]> playBack(int tick,
                                                          java.util.Vector<Pair> focus)
Returns list of coordinates dictated by the JointPairs in focus

Parameters:
tick -
focus -
Returns:

getJointPosition

private processing.core.PVector[] getJointPosition(int tick,
                                                   int con1,
                                                   int con2,
                                                   java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> focus)
Retrieves the position of two joints as specified by con1 and con2 the joints are only retrieved if both contained in this and in focus.

Parameters:
tick - : time tick to pull coordinates from
con1 - : joint one
con2 - : joint two
focus - : collection of focus joints
Returns:
Position of two joints as a PVector[2]

null if the joints are not available/focused

getTicks

public int getTicks()
Returns:
The size of the recorder, thus representing the number of ticks

getPlayBackTick

public int getPlayBackTick()

contains

public boolean contains(int j)
Checks if joints contains j

Parameters:
j - : value to check for
Returns:
True if joints contains j. False in all other cases.

containsAll

public boolean containsAll(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> j)
Check if j is a subset of joints

Parameters:
j - : Set to check for
Returns:
True if j is a subset of joints. False otherwise.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Checks if there is any current recorded data, this will return true if there is no recorded data but there is focus joints.

Returns:
True if recorder is empty. False else.

clear

public void clear()
Clears the recorder, deleting the current recording, isEmpty() will return true after this is called until record() is called. Focus joints will remain. To remove focus joints use clearFocus()

clearFocus

public void clearFocus()
Clears focus joints, as these are linked to the recording the recording is also cleared.

See Also:
clear()
